title: Seen&Noted#1: Bad Words: The Case Against Decadent Fonts
content:
And you thought that only typophiles had deep interest in font and typeface posts?

[**Bad Words: The Case Against Decadent Fonts**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124155854/http:/www.citizen-journal.net/gmhome/archives/00000177.htm)  
from _The Citizen Journal_  
Conservative Political Forum, Articles & Resources

The above article spawned a new topic thread:  
 [**Sans-Serif? Sans-Any Sense of Decency or Responsibillity!**](http://web.archive.org/)  
(the above url is not linking due to its long length)  
 [http://daddytypes.com/archive/2005/06/19/sansserif\_sansany\_sense\_of\_dece...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124155854/http:/daddytypes.com/archive/2005/06/19/sansserif_sansany_sense_of_decency_or_responsibility.html "http://daddytypes.com/archive/2005/06/19/sansserif\_sansany\_sense\_of\_decency\_or\_responsibility.html")  
from _DaddyTypes.com_  
The Web Log for New Dads
author: Norbert Florendo

comments.content: Politicaly conservative pundits have such a hard time with parody/sarcasm/humour that I honestly can't tell if they're being serious or not.

The basic tenet of these articles, which appears to be that wacky fonts cause kids to behave in a wacky manner, is certainly one of the most bizarre contentions I have heard in a long time. Of course, for parents I suppose it is always easier to find something (or someone) else to blame for a child's bad behavior.

I was just amazed that topics about typefaces (fonts as the rest of the world commonly misuses) should appear in a forum for new fathers.

On the other hand, it occurred to me that urban graffiti letter shapes of the sixties have evolved into a sort of youth art form commonly associated with hiphop, rap gangs and wannabees.

It was just a matter of time before some "styles" were available as fonts.

[Johan Waldenstrom's designs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124155854/http:/members.chello.se/johan.waldenstrom/fonts11d1.htm) apparently were used for the [Coca-Cola Soundwave campaign.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124155854/http:/members.chello.se/johan.waldenstrom/font_examples.htm)

Just as with music, art and clothing, each generation creates a genre to represent itself. And as always, marketers are there to repackage old snake-oil.

---------------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but I still wear beads and sandal!
